intro: Romulea bulbocodium subsp. rouyana, commonly known as the rouyana squill, is a member of the Iridaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a bulbous perennial plant characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of pale yellow to white flowers. The plant produces small, round bulbs that serve as storage organs and aid in its propagation. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
